Course.Title: BASIC FRENCH II
Course.Description: Introduction to French, focusing on the relation-ship between language and culture.  Emphasis on developing grammatical competence and communicative skills: listening, speaking, reading, and writing in the target language.  Required laboratory component.  Six credit hours (in sequence) of one foreign language must be successfully completed to receive three credit hours toward the General Education Disciplinary Requirement.

Sections.CourseDescription: Introduction to French, focusing on the relation-ship between language and culture. MeetingsDisplay: Tuesday, Thursday 5:30 PM - 6:45 PM WKU General Education Hall C307 (Lecture)
Sections.Title: BASIC FRENCH II

Course.Title: COMPUTERS IN GRAPHIC DESIGN I
Course.Description: A studio course providing an introduction to drawing, type, image editing and image creation software. The course provides the foundation skills for the use of graphics software as a tool for visualizing and creative problem solving in design. Lectures and studio projects in design fundamentals (elements and principals) and basic image creation. Supply fees, laptop and printer required.

Sections.CourseDescription: A studio course providing an introduction to drawing, type, image editing and image creation software. The course provides the foundation skills for the use of graphics software as a tool for visualizing and creative problem solving in design. Lectures and studio projects in design fundamentals (elements and principals) and basic image creation. Supply fees, laptop and printer required.
MeetingsDisplay: Monday 12:00 PM - 5:50 PM WKU Gehekai Hall F407B (Lecture)
Sections.FullTitleDisplay: GD*1000*W01 COMPUTERS IN GRAPHIC DESIGN I
Sections.Title: COMPUTERS IN GRAPHIC DESIGN I

Course.Title: TYPOGRAPHY II
Course.Description: Studio course continuing the study and practice of typography. The primary function of typography as the visual voice of language is explored. Emphasis upon type in multiple page formats, such as editorial design and corporate communications; use of design software. Laptop required.

Sections.CourseDescription: Studio course continuing the study and practice of typography. The primary function of typography as the visual voice of language is explored. Course.Title: GRAPH DESIGN FUNDAMENTALS II
Course.Description: Studio course covering basic principles of graphic design for print and screen as applied to editorial design, promotional design, and interactive design. Laptop required; purchase of supplies, TC conference ticket and field trips required.

Course.Title: HIST OF VIS COMM
Course.Description: A historical survey of visual communications from prehistoric cave paintings to contemporary graphic design and advertising across media channels.  Emphasis on the twentieth century visual arts. Field trips and fees.

Course.Title: ADVERTISING I
Course.Description: Studio in the creative area of advertising design. The fundamentals of print, digital media, social media, and innovative media will be covered. Students will create advertisements with a visual and written component. Copywriting for advertising will be studied. Supply fees and field trip fees required.

Sections.CourseDescription: Studio in the creative area of advertising design. The fundamentals of print, digital media, social media, and innovative media will be covered. Course.Title: WEB & INTERACTIVE DESIGN I
Course.Description: A studio course that provides the foundation for developing skill in concept development, designing, and the fundamental production of web and other screen based interactive applications. The focus is basic technology and problem solving, concepting, developing ideas for interactivity, and visualization of concepts for advertising, promotional and editorial design. Supply fees, personal laptop required.

Sections.CourseDescription: A studio course that provides the foundation for developing skill in concept development, designing, and the fundamental production of web and other screen based interactive applications. The focus is basic technology and problem solving, concepting, developing ideas for interactivity, and visualization of concepts for advertising, promotional and editorial design. Supply fees, personal laptop required.
MeetingsDisplay: Monday 12:00 PM - 5:50 PM WKU Gehekai Hall D203 (Lecture)

Course.Title: GRAPHIC DESIGN PORTFOLIO
Course.Description: Studio course for the creation, refinement, organization, and presentation of the student's final portfolio of creative work. Includes review of career options, interview techniques, portfolio review and senior exhibition. Supply fees, field trip fees, and laptop required. May be repeated once for credit.

Course.Title: CONCEPT TO PRINT
Course.Description: Studio course developing skills used in the preparation of artwork for reproduction by commercial printing process, including tools, introduction to printing technology, single and multi-color printing, process printing, paper and ink selection, specs and measures, and production techniques. Supply fees and laptop required.

Sections.CourseDescription: Studio course developing skills used in the preparation of artwork for reproduction by commercial printing process, including tools, introduction to printing technology, single and multi-color printing, process printing, paper and ink selection, specs and measures, and production techniques. Sections.Title: CONCEPT TO PRINT

Course.Title: BRAND STRATEGIES AND DESIGN
Course.Description: An advanced studio course on branding. The principles of brand building strategy, concepts, design, copywriting, and storytelling will be covered. Students will create transmedia branding campaigns. Emphasis will be on the conceptual and design skills necessary to create effective branding building. Laptop required. Purchase of supplies, attendance at the Thinking Creatively Conference, and field trips required.  May be repeated once for credit.

Sections.CourseDescription: An advanced studio course on branding. The principles of brand building strategy, concepts, design, copywriting, and storytelling will be covered. Students will create transmedia branding campaigns. Emphasis will be on the conceptual and design skills necessary to create effective branding building. Laptop required. Purchase of supplies, attendance at the Thinking Creatively Conference, and field trips required.  May be repeated once for credit.
MeetingsDisplay: Thursday 9:30 AM - 3:20 PM WKU Gehekai Hall B208 (Lecture)

Course.Title: RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY
Course.Description: Introduction to the research process for students with majors in the College of Business and Public Management.  Preparation of a formal research paper. Emphasizes the use of library resources and interdisciplinary approaches to designing, investigating, and reporting research activities. Writing Intensive.
